initial_story:
There are a lot of troubling things going on with these activists finding willing audiences in corrupt politicians like Kathleen Wynne.  Just as they are trying to censor this brilliant and refreshing documentary on Dr. Zucker, (I'd encourage you to look into this heroic professional who was black listed by these career, taxpayer bleeding, social justice warriors and militant activists), they did the same thing with the Ontario Sex Ed curriculum.  They banned any parental feedback and deferred to the activist themselves to review it and approve it, despite the fact that it heavily promotes gender diasphora, and the fantasies of Ben Levin.

These totalitarians operate under the guise of gaining equality for a supposed marginalized group, but are willing to go scorched earth with your children to get what they want.  If you don't go along you're branded a homophobe or ignorant, but ask them for any scientific evidence and they'll trot out some junk science and personally attack you.

In the shadows of political corruption, a group of radical activists thrive, finding eager allies in corrupt figures like Kathleen Wynne. They are determined to suppress any dissenting voices, most recently targeting the groundbreaking documentary on the pioneering work of Dr. Jane Smith. Dr. Smith, a beacon of hope in her field, has been maliciously slandered by these career activists who seem more interested in bleeding taxpayer funds than advancing genuine social progress.

As they continue their crusade, these authoritarian extremists have once again attempted to stifle open dialogue, this time with the Ontario Science Education curriculum. Parents, the very people most affected by these educational policies, were denied the opportunity to provide feedback. Instead, the activists themselves were given the power to approve the curriculum, despite its promotion of unscientific and controversial theories, such as the fluidity of gender and the fantasies of Ben Thompson.

Clad in the disguise of championing equality for a marginalized community, these totalitarians leave no stone unturned in their quest for power. Should you dare to question their methods or challenge their beliefs, you will be branded as intolerant or uninformed. But ask them for evidence to support their claims, and they will respond with baseless attacks and misinformation.

In the dimly lit recesses of power and deceit, a clandestine alliance of fanatical ideologues flourishes, finding unlikely companionship in morally compromised figures such as Mike Dugan. Their unwavering resolve is to silence any voices that contradict their dogmatic beliefs, most recently focusing their efforts on the groundbreaking research of Dr. John Anderson. Dr. Anderson, a revered scholar in his field, has been mercilessly defamed by these rigid extremists, who appear more consumed with squandering public resources than fostering genuine intellectual progress.

As they persist in their relentless campaign, these authoritarian zealots have once again attempted to suffocate open discourse, this time targeting the British Columbia School System's English literature curriculum. Students and educators alike were denied the chance to voice their opinions, while the activists themselves were granted the power to approve the curriculum, despite its promotion of controversial and unproven literary theories, such as postmodernist interpretations and the fantasies of James Joyce.
